author: jgm
content: For the multi-client testnet is the plan to go for a full 32 Ether deposit?

author: donschoe
content: Probably not, we will certainly have a couple of testnets that might get stuck or fail otherwise before having persistent, long-term, multi-client testnets. Therefore, we would not want to burn too much testnet ether.

author: jgm
content: You could add a `withdraw()` that returned funds to the creator of the contract, if needs be

author: jgm
content: And if you consider that https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/pull/1635 could have been picked up by a large testnet with 32 Ether deposits but no chance with 3.2 Ether deposits, I'd hope that for the sake of a few worthless test Ether the multiclient testnet chain is run with mainnet parameters

author: donschoe
content: I'm no disagreeing. Ideally, we have a testnet at some point that has exactly the same parameters as mainnet.

author: donschoe
content: I'm just saying, we progressively need to get there. So first testnets can have a lower deposit to ease more fundamental tasks of cross-client testing.
